instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Has liquid damage , after cleaning it will turn on , light comes 
on the charger , then light on the charger disappear after few 20-30 seconds . The charger goes to protection status , I must 
unplug it from wall to work again .
i replaced I/o board and the flex cable , checked J9500 all pins
are clean inside and outside the connector .
replacec battery . Still doing same .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 voltage.
Try it with lab power supply, or fake charger.
Measure <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 onboard, 200K scale; should discard <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> issue.
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> and voltages in that area.
